channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: YOLOv9: Learning What You Want to Learn Using Programmable Gradient Information
item.description: It can be used to obtain complete information, so that train-from-scratch models can achieve better results than state-of-the-art models pre-trained using large datasets, the comparison results are shown in Figure 1.

item.title: World Model on Million-Length Video And Language With RingAttention
item.description: This work paves the way for training on massive datasets of long video and language to develop understanding of both human knowledge and the multimodal world, and broader capabilities.

item.title: Scalable Diffusion Models with Transformers
item.description: We explore a new class of diffusion models based on the transformer architecture.

item.title: UFO: A UI-Focused Agent for Windows OS Interaction
item.description: We introduce UFO, an innovative UI-Focused agent to fulfill user requests tailored to applications on Windows OS, harnessing the capabilities of GPT-Vision.

item.title: Revisiting Feature Prediction for Learning Visual Representations from Video
item.description: This paper explores feature prediction as a stand-alone objective for unsupervised learning from video and introduces V-JEPA, a collection of vision models trained solely using a feature prediction objective, without the use of pretrained image encoders, text, negative examples, reconstruction, or other sources of supervision.

item.title: Neural Network Diffusion
item.description: The autoencoder extracts latent representations of a subset of the trained network parameters.

item.title: GaussianObject: Just Taking Four Images to Get A High-Quality 3D Object with Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Then we construct a Gaussian repair model based on diffusion models to supplement the omitted object information, where Gaussians are further refined.

item.title: YOLO-World: Real-Time Open-Vocabulary Object Detection
item.description: The You Only Look Once (YOLO) series of detectors have established themselves as efficient and practical tools.

item.title: FiT: Flexible Vision Transformer for Diffusion Model
item.description: Nature is infinitely resolution-free.

item.title: SiT: Exploring Flow and Diffusion-based Generative Models with Scalable Interpolant Transformers
item.description: We present Scalable Interpolant Transformers (SiT), a family of generative models built on the backbone of Diffusion Transformers (DiT).

item.title: DataDreamer: A Tool for Synthetic Data Generation and Reproducible LLM Workflows
item.description: The rapid rise to prominence of these models and these unique challenges has had immediate adverse impacts on open science and on the reproducibility of work that uses them.

item.title: OpenFedLLM: Training Large Language Models on Decentralized Private Data via Federated Learning
item.description: Trained on massive publicly available data, large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated tremendous success across various fields.

item.title: Generative Representational Instruction Tuning
item.description: Notably, we find that GRIT matches training on only generative or embedding data, thus we can unify both at no performance loss.

item.title: Data Engineering for Scaling Language Models to 128K Context
item.description: We demonstrate that continual pretraining of the full model on 1B-5B tokens of such data is an effective and affordable strategy for scaling the context length of language models to 128K.

item.title: DoRA: Weight-Decomposed Low-Rank Adaptation
item.description: By employing DoRA, we enhance both the learning capacity and training stability of LoRA while avoiding any additional inference overhead.

item.title: Language-Codec: Reducing the Gaps Between Discrete Codec Representation and Speech Language Models
item.description: Furthermore, we also validate the efficiency of the Language-Codec on downstream speech language models.

item.title: Extreme Video Compression with Pre-trained Diffusion Models
item.description: The results showcase the potential of exploiting the temporal relations in video data using generative models.

item.title: Linear Transformers with Learnable Kernel Functions are Better In-Context Models
item.description: Advancing the frontier of subquadratic architectures for Language Models (LMs) is crucial in the rapidly evolving field of natural language processing.

item.title: TorchCP: A Library for Conformal Prediction based on PyTorch
item.description: TorchCP is a Python toolbox for conformal prediction research on deep learning models.

item.title: Magic-Me: Identity-Specific Video Customized Diffusion
item.description: In the field of text-to-image generation (T2I), subject-driven content generation has achieved great progress with the ID in the images controllable.
